content.text: The TracWater Mini Buoy acquires and transmits real-time water-quality data from surface water bodies using an integrated chain of sensors, gateways, and cloud-based infrastructure. The data flow begins at the immersed multiparameter sonde and continues through to the TracWater IAAS platform, where measurements are stored, processed, analysed, and ultimately presented to customers through online portals, alarm notifications, and automated exception reports.

runs.text: The TracWater Mini Buoy acquires and transmits real-time water-quality data from surface water bodies using an integrated chain of sensors, gateways, and cloud-based infrastructure. The data flow begins at the immersed multiparameter sonde and continues through to the TracWater IAAS platform, where measurements are stored, processed, analysed, and ultimately presented to customers through online portals, alarm notifications, and automated exception reports.

content.text: Subsequent sections describe each stage of this flow in detail, from local sensor acquisition to the cloud-based interpretation and presentation of results.

runs.text: Subsequent sections describe each stage of this flow in detail, from local sensor acquisition to the cloud-based interpretation and presentation of results.

subsections.title: TracWater Mini Buoy – Data Flow Overview (Text Diagram)

content.text: • IAAS decodes MQTT responses ↠ engineering units via MODBUS Map &
• Data stored in Time-Series DB ↠ processed datasets ↠ portal visualisation

The multiparameter sonde is equipped with a range of water-quality sensors (e.g. dissolved oxygen, pH, temperature, turbidity, oxidation-reduction potential). Each measurement is stored within the sonde’s internal MODBUS RS-485 registers.

runs.text: The multiparameter sonde is equipped with a range of water-quality sensors (e.g. dissolved oxygen, pH, temperature, turbidity, oxidation-reduction potential). Each measurement is stored within the sonde’s internal MODBUS RS-485 registers.

content.text: The sonde operates as a MODBUS slave device, identified by a unique MODBUS ID, and continuously maintains updated measurement values in its holding registers.

runs.text: The sonde operates as a MODBUS slave device, identified by a unique MODBUS ID, and continuously maintains updated measurement values in its holding registers.

content.text: Although the sonde is physically connected to the MQTT MODBUS Gateway via RS-485, the gateway functions purely as a protocol bridge between the RS-485 bus and the MQTT broker. The gateway does not act as the MODBUS master.

runs.text: Although the sonde is physically connected to the MQTT MODBUS Gateway via RS-485, the gateway functions purely as a protocol bridge between the RS-485 bus and the MQTT broker. The gateway does not act as the MODBUS master.

content.text: The TracWater IAAS server application assumes the logical role of the MODBUS master, generating MODBUS read requests that are encapsulated within MQTT messages. These requests pass through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway, which transparently relays them to the sonde and returns the retrieved register data to the broker for collection by TracWater IAAS.

runs.text: The TracWater IAAS server application assumes the logical role of the MODBUS master, generating MODBUS read requests that are encapsulated within MQTT messages. These requests pass through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway, which transparently relays them to the sonde and returns the retrieved register data to the broker for collection by TracWater IAAS.

content.text: The multiparameter sonde connects via a hard-wired RS-485 link to a MQTT MODBUS Gateway (e.g. Teltonika TRB145).

runs.text: The multiparameter sonde connects via a hard-wired

content.text: The gateway serves as a network bridge that enables legacy MODBUS RTU slave devices to be queried by modern, server-based MODBUS master software over an IP network. It provides a translation layer between RS-485 MODBUS RTU and MQTT, allowing commands originating from TracWater IAAS to reach the sonde without requiring a persistent serial connection.

runs.text: that enables legacy MODBUS RTU slave devices to be queried by modern, server-based MODBUS master software over an IP network. It provides a translation layer between
to reach the sonde without requiring a persistent serial connection.

content.text: Maintains the physical RS-485 connection to the sonde.

runs.text: Maintains the physical RS-485 connection to the sonde.

content.text: Subscribes to its assigned MQTT request topic to receive encoded MODBUS read commands.

runs.text: topic to receive encoded MODBUS read commands.

content.text: Executes those commands locally against the sonde and publishes the results to the MQTT response topic.

runs.text: Executes those commands locally against the sonde and publishes the results to the MQTT

content.text: Although it performs the serial query locally, the gateway does so on behalf of the TracWater IAAS application, which remains the true MODBUS master. This design provides a powerful and efficient way to make traditional RS-485 instruments securely accessible to cloud-based systems.

runs.text: Although it performs the serial query locally, the gateway does so

the TracWater IAAS application, which remains the true MODBUS master. This design provides a powerful and efficient way to make traditional RS-485 instruments securely accessible to cloud-based systems.

content.text: These dedicated topics isolate message traffic per buoy, ensuring unambiguous routing of requests and responses.

runs.text: These dedicated topics isolate message traffic per buoy, ensuring unambiguous routing of requests and responses.

Accuracy – IEEE-754 conversion preserves floating-point precision.

content.text: The MODBUS Register Map defines every data point available for read access between the TracWater Mini Buoy’s multiparameter sonde and the TracWater IAAS application. It specifies the address, length, unit, and description of each parameter stored within the device’s internal registers.

Changes to register definitions or conversion categories require approval by the CTO or delegated Engineering Authority.
All approved revisions are logged in the Document Revision Register.

subsections.title: MODBUS Data Conversion Methods and Categories

content.text: Each register listed in Section MODBUS Register Map includes a field titled Conversion Method (Category #), which identifies the decoding logic that the TracWater IAAS platform applies when interpreting the raw data stored within the device’s MODBUS registers.

runs.text: , which identifies the decoding logic that the
platform applies when interpreting the raw data stored within the device’s MODBUS registers.

content.text: The Conversion Method number corresponds directly to the conversion categories defined in this section.

runs.text: number corresponds directly to the conversion categories defined in this section.

content.text: These categories describe how different Stored Value Types (for example, 32-bit IEEE 754 floats, 16-bit shorts, bit-fields, ASCII strings, or hexadecimal codes) are translated into usable engineering values, textual identifiers, or operational statuses within the TracWater IAAS system.

runs.text: (for example, 32-bit IEEE 754 floats, 16-bit shorts, bit-fields, ASCII strings, or hexadecimal codes) are translated into usable engineering values, textual identifiers, or operational statuses within the TracWater IAAS system.

content.text: By maintaining a one-to-one mapping between each register’s Conversion Method (Category #) in Section 4.9 and the decoding procedure documented in this section, the TracWater IAAS platform ensures accurate, deterministic, and auditable interpretation of all data retrieved from MODBUS devices connected via the MQTT MODBUS Gateway.

runs.text: By maintaining a one-to-one mapping between each register’s

in Section 4.9 and the decoding procedure documented in this section, the TracWater IAAS platform ensures accurate, deterministic, and auditable interpretation of all data retrieved from MODBUS devices connected via the MQTT MODBUS Gateway.

content.text: This section defines the standardised conversion methods that the TracWater IAAS platform applies to interpret register values returned by MODBUS-based devices connected through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway.

runs.text: This section defines the standardised conversion methods that the
platform applies to interpret register values returned by MODBUS-based devices connected through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway.

content.text: Each MODBUS device stores its measurement or status information in binary or encoded form. To ensure accurate and consistent decoding across devices, TracWater IAAS implements six defined conversion categories, each corresponding to a specific register format and decoding rule.

runs.text: ach MODBUS device stores its measurement or status information in binary or encoded form. To ensure accurate and consistent decoding across devices, TracWater IAAS implements six defined
, each corresponding to a specific register format and decoding rule.

runs.text: The system then applies the matching decoding logic to convert the raw 16-bit register data into human-readable engineering values (e.g. floats, integers, ASCII strings, or enumerated codes).

content.text: The conversion categories ensure consistent interpretation regardless of device model or firmware.

runs.text: The conversion categories ensure consistent interpretation regardless of device model or firmware.

runs.text: The following conversion categories are defined for TracWater Mini Buoy and related devices.

content.text: Description: Used for sensors that output 32-bit IEEE 754 floating-point values (e.g. dissolved oxygen, turbidity, conductivity, pH, temperature, salinity, oxidation-reduction potential).

runs.text: Used for sensors that output 32-bit IEEE 754 floating-point values (e.g. dissolved oxygen, turbidity, conductivity, pH, temperature, salinity, oxidation-reduction potential).

content.text: Conversion Method: Combine two 16-bit signed short values, reverse the byte order (DCBA → ABCD), then convert the resulting 32-bit binary string to a float using IEEE 754 format.

runs.text: Combine two 16-bit signed short values, reverse the byte order (DCBA → ABCD), then convert the resulting 32-bit binary string to a float using IEEE 754 format.

Description: Used for textual identifiers such as OEM serial numbers or alphanumeric labels.
Conversion Method: Each 16-bit register contains two bytes, each representing an ASCII character. Convert and concatenate all bytes sequentially to form the final string.

content.text: This section defines the raw data assets that provide the foundation for all TracWater IAAS processed data.

content.text: A raw data asset is any digital measurement, status, or operational value captured directly from a TracWater-connected device or system and stored in a TracWater database prior to any transformation or analytical processing.

runs.text: is any digital measurement, status, or operational value captured directly from a TracWater-connected device or system and stored in a TracWater database prior to any transformation or analytical processing.

content.text: Raw data assets include, but are not limited to:

runs.text: include, but are not limited to:

content.text: Instrument outputs received through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway (see Sections 4.9 and 4.10).

runs.text: received through the MQTT MODBUS Gateway (see Sections 4.9 and 4.10).

content.text: Direct serial or network feeds from other field devices (e.g. SDI-12 sondes, pulse counters, analog converters).

runs.text: from other field devices (e.g. SDI-12 sondes, pulse counters,

content.text: System telemetry such as gateway signal strength, battery voltage, internal temperature, and operational heartbeat.

content.text: External data integrations (e.g. Bureau of Meteorology rainfall feeds, third-party SCADA values, or customer-provided datasets).

content.text: Each raw data source is uniquely identified within TracWater IAAS by its Device ID and Data Tag metadata, ensuring unambiguous traceability from acquisition through to processed outputs.

metadata, ensuring unambiguous traceability from acquisition through to processed outputs.

content.text: Immutable — once recorded, raw values are not altered, only superseded by later measurements.
